intro: Cubilia blancoi, commonly known as the Blanco's cubilia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
